caption: First time there, they were clearly short but we were ok with waiting a bit as we had just driven 3 hours and were really hoping for a meal. Ordered drinks and 2 burgers right off the bat. One out of two drinks was wrong, but we let it go. Over an hour later the lights were flashed indicating last call, and we were told at that time that there were no burgers left. Also that each small drink was $14 each. We ended up going to a Wawa, should have just done that in the first place. Will absolutely never go there again.
Great vibe. Lowkey, no frills bar.

Ummm, this place is like being in NY, maybe even Italy,  at a fine Italian restaurant. Music, atmosphere,  I almost forgot I was in Hong Kong.  My fiance found this place because we both love italian food so he took me here for my birthday.  The wait staff, at least most of them, speak Italian, we got to meet a lovely young lady, she served us, with, exceptional care, and she was just AMAZING. So sorry, I lost her name, but she is from Italy, so friendly and we fell in love with her! We travel to Hong Kong quite a bit, we will always make it a point to visit this restaurant when we are in Hong Kong.  Try the Eggplant parmigiana. EVERYTHING they make is EXCEPTIONAL!  You guys are champions👑🙏
I loved everything about it from the drinks to the food to the manager the atmosphere was peaceful but yet party like no drama definitely recommend this place
I wish this was my neighborhood bar. Treated us tourists very well
It's my go-to, whenever I can I take people there. Great vibe, great music, nice staff, and they pour a generous whiskey 👍
Casual and full of locals!
Love the atmosphere, music, and drink at 1831. Yes, I said drink. Could only handle one of these hurricanes. Delicious but super strong. Will definitely come back!
Awesome bar.  Will be back
Great happy hour! No complaints
Good drinks
The personalities, the bartenders, the atmosphere are all awesome. And happy hour is on point.
The day we visited, the staff was short but they were very nice and friendly. The drinks were great, wish I could of tried the food.

Wonderful establishment and great level of service provided.  I recently held a private event there, and was a total success in large part to the effort made my by staff and owner.  Highly recommend this place for events and early evening happy hours.  Food and drinks were delicious!  Communication leading up to the event with the owner to outline details and pricing was clear and easy to understand.  Thank you 1831 for your level of professionalism and willingness to help me host a private event.
Awesome happy hour specials. Great place to meet after work and unwind or to plan a small get together. Booths upstairs are perfect for quasi intimate drinking/snacking.
Drinks and food weren't great...i ordered a jack and coke and it barely had any flavor (maybe the ice melted into it)
Poor service all around.

This is one of my new favorite night spots in DC. We had left dinner and were looking for a nightcap, and literally stumbled to 1831. It was a great find. The drinks were reasonable, the menu looked great. The staff were amazing, the football was on the TV. Just about perfect.
Nice relaxing environment, tasty drinks
Lil cool spot in city. Good music, good vibes & the food was good to.. Multiple screens for the game 👌🏽
It’s a very nice restaurant
Chill place with cool drinks and bar tenders. Sat has good throwback music. Hiphop

Slowest and rudest service we've ever had in a bar. We were made to feel like an inconvenience, interrupting the conversations staff were having. Total shame as the bar space is great. The quickest we ever saw the staff move is when they dashed to the check to see what we had tipped.
Great drinks and awesome staff. Wide variety of drinks and well priced. All the food that I've had is delicious. The soups and wings are my favorite
Drinks are way too sweet

This is a great spot in the city centre! Liked the seating and layout, the vibe was good and the music was great! The wait times however were really really bad. We stood at the bar waiting for at least 10-15 minutes just waiting to be acknowledged  by 1 bartender so we could order a drink. Our food also took a while to arrive. Probably went on a bad night with short staff, but we didn't even think about another round.
Cozy underground bar, and they make great cocktails! Only downside is it can get crowded during happy hour due to its location and size

I went to the 1831 Bar and Lounge. I waited 20 minutes for a drink. Normally, I wouldn't mind this but they repeatedly skipped me. Once they began to make my drink, they didn't know what went into it. They also started making it and let it sit while the ice melted. I am disappointed by this.
Draft beers are spot on and the music keeps you feeling refreshed and energised.

This bar was fun! The bartenders are friendly and make really good drinks! I was in town for a weekend and came here two nights in a row because I knew I could come here for affordable, strong drinks. Music was good too!
Nice!!!
Great food and drinks. Shakira was friendly and attentive. Some gluten free, vegan, and vegetarian options, but not many.
Beautiful place. Great music. I liked the decor. Staff were nice. Services was great. Food was good. Perfect lighting.
Not the most welcoming to a lone traveller but warmed up
Awesome people, awesome vibes. STRONG DRINKS!!! Will be back ❤️
Cool place for a relaxing drink with your friends.
Awesome
Great staff

Listen. These fish sticks changed my life. Also, Emily is honestly one of the best bartenders I’ve ever encountered. I came in, very clearly upset and her service has surpassed anything i could’ve asked for and that’s considering someone who has worked in the service industry for year.

This is not a cocktail bar, instead it’s a young professional bar where the bartender asks you if you have ID before even greeting you! Not my scene, but young professionals looking for a decent happy hour to get hammered at will find this meets their needs.
So many good memories here !
Really cool atmosphere and decent cocktails, good for hanging out for an evening
Great service and strong drinks, a must for happy hour
The evening we were there they had only one server - but she did an AMAZING job managing all of the tables. Good bar food. REALLY strong drinks. Fun times!!
Excellent chicken wings, and or excellent drinks as well! Service was pretty slow, but the bartender was training someone new, and it was an off time
One of my favorite venues to attend for happy hour. The dim lighting combined with a great playlist over drinks fits perfect here. Give it a try and I promise that you will not be disappointed.
Service was awful. Bill was wrong.

This place is great. The music selection is on-point, the wings and calamari are delicious. They even have an 8oz lo ester special that's good 👍🏽. The drink servings are nice and the waitresses are very friendly. I am definitely going back.
Unusual atmosphere, service was a little blasé and the drinks were all very sweet.
Crowded

Great happy hour deals, cool drink specials, and a very cool interior, but we had the strangest service there. The bartender looked confused and frazzled despite the place being almost empty. He was also extremely slow and forgot about the one drink we ordered, hopefully he's new? The woman working was constantly singing along to the music very loudly, it didn't bother me but was kind of strange. Their house "margarita" is just a cup filled most of the way with rail liquor and then a splash of orange juice on top... nothing else. I expected way better considering the great ratings this place has. The food was decent. The steak sandwich was great, my friends burger looked good, but the french onion soup had way too much cheese.
Nice dive bar type. Good prices during happy hours. Though we tried the Margarita and it was nothing to write home about.

(Translated by Google) We had lunch on the fly before leaving because it is close to the hotel where we stayed. It's more of an evening bar than a place for lunch. Despite this we ate well. Drank a good glass of wine (also plenty) and the girl who served us was super nice  (Original) Abbiamo pranzato al volo prima di ripartire visto che è vicino all' hotel dove abbiamo soggiornato. È più un bar serale che un luogo adatto al pranzo. Nonostante questo abbiamo mangiato bene. Bevuto un buon bicchiere di vino( anche abbondante) e la ragazza che ci ha servito è stata super gentile

The Hurricane cocktail is the best hurricane cocktail I have ever had; the wings are delicious and the Happy Hour specials are the best I have ever seen on the East Coast! Wonderful Service and I enjoy the music and atmosphere.
Best Happy Hour in Washington, D.C. !!! Excellent Service and Great Atmosphere!

Come to 1831 Bar and Lounge for its great happy hour which features very cheap drinks (i.e. $1 Natty Lights, $6 Tito’s Vodka, and $15 bottle of Sauvignon Blanc). It runs Monday – Friday until 8 p.m. and Saturday and Sunday until 6 p.m. No food is included in the happy hour specials, but I wouldn’t recommend coming here for food anyways. I ordered the wings – you get only about 6-7 wings and they are the smallest wings I’ve ever encountered, smaller than my pinky finger (see photos)! The bartenders and staff are very friendly and attentive (if you sit at tables in the bar area, the staff will come take your order and even remind you when happy hour is nearing its end). They really focus on good customer service. As for the layout, the main bar is on the lower level and features a lot of blue lights strung from the ceiling (see photos). There is a section towards the back with booths and TVs. It can get loud and crowded fast, so get there a little early and snag a high-table in the main bar area. It’s not a classy place, but for the happy hour drink prices, you can’t beat it anywhere in the Dupont Circle area.
Amazing Drinks!!!!  Amazing Service!!!
I sincerely love 1831 Bar & Lounge! It is special and unique in all aspects. Amazing specials and excellent service! Definitely the best happy hour in the city and really delicious food!

Terrible service. When pouring a $13 beer, the bartender spilled a significant amount and the glass was half foam. Lost half of what I paid for and the manager refused to do anything, telling us we got what we paid for...which was clearly not the case. He then threatened to kick us out.
Food is Excellent and the Happy Hour is out of this world!
Best Happy Hour!  Best Wings!  Best Bar in DC!  Best Best Best!

Entrance reeked of piss and the bar looked dirty. I wasn't expecting 4 star luxury but I wasn't too excited to be sitting at a bar while flies flew around my food and drinks. Nonetheless food was average, drinks were ok, and happy hour ends at 8pm on weekdays.
Great appetizer - flat bread with chicken was pretty packed. Great drinks - the 1831 and Jules Verne were great.
Music is really loud!!!!

Came in on a saturday night it was no one in there besides a lady at the bar which happens to be very rude to us. I walked with my boyfriend I asked the bartender where the bathroom was she pointed its up the steps, i walked towards the steps where i was interrupted by the lady yelling stating that we need to buy a drink before going to the bathroom, I said I will after I use the bathroom she said yelling and slurring well we need to hold your card while you go use the bathroom, I'm lost for words of how rude she was and the bartenders didn't step in to say anything so I assume she works there may be off because she was drinking at the bar and in regular clothes soo my boyfriend said you know what, let's leave I'm not feeling this place anymore and go next door. as we leaving the security asked what happened why we leaving we told him what happened, he just shocked his head and said sorry, this lady had very short hair and a bad attitude that will scare your customer away. beware of her. Next door was the Camelot they didn't asked to hold my credit card to go to the bathroom.
The food was actually good. All bar food aren't created equally.
Cheap Beer & wings- can’t complain
The people there are Awesome!
Great interior to the bar with solid happy hour deals. Only complaint was that the music was very loud for a happy hour. Volume was more appropriate for the late evening than post-work crowd.
Very chill lounge with great staff and good music. This place is unpredictable in a great way! One minute you're sippin on Gin and Juice then the next you're caught in a Bad Romance 😍
Fun bar good cocktails
The drinks are stronger than you can imagine.
Best Happy Hour on the planet!
Nice atmosphere GOOD service GOOD music
Great happy hour prices during the weekdays 4-7 and weekends during the day! Came here on Sunday around 3:30pm, and they had great drink specials! Hard to beat $3 Yuengling drafts in DC!
Nice atmosphere, good drinks, and excellent service. A great place to meet your friends at and have a drink.
Great service!

Had the absolute worst service ever here with a group of friends. We had called ahead to see if it was okay to bring 20+ people on a Sunday evening and were told sure, and had the back room reserved. When we got there, the single bartender was totally overwhelmed and apparently didn't know we were coming? We took up 4 or 5 tables and it took 90 minutes from ordering to getting our drinks, let alone food. Most of us gave up and left at that point, and it still took another half hour to get our checks and cards back. Then they tried to charge for the food they didn't make in the two hours we'd been there. Every 30 minutes or so the bartender would come by with another tables drinks, with the ice half melted, so when some of tried to go to the bar to order with cash (they still had our cards) they refused to pour a drink or take our money. The first few times people complained to the manager he actually said he couldn't help. Couldn't even pour a drink and wouldn't help the poor over worked bartender carry a tray. Absolutely clueless.
Great drinks
Too loud, impossible to talk or relax
Ashley and shakira will hook you up. Thanks for everything
Atmosphere was great...
Great place! Location in center and easy to find. But should go before time because parking so busy
Place best suited, if you're on budget
Celebrated my Birthday here. Had a private area for me and my guest. Bartenders was amazing and so was the atmosphere. Can't wait to visit again.
Great drinks and the DJ was good also. Great bat crawl spot
Cool space, friendly staff but $9 with tip for an IPA  in a 10oz glass? Come on.
The service was slow during happy hour.
Great atmosphere and fantastic happy hour specials.
great service strong drinks
I love this small space. Very good drinking atmosphere. The owner is amazing and she is always smiling. Don't hesitate to stop here and become a patron.
Nice staff!!
One of the longer happy hours in the area--typically good music, although they sometimes close early on slow nights.
Kind of a hole in the wall with an interesting steam punk theme. Nicely garnished drinks! Fair prices!
Great happy hour and always good service
Good happy hour prices, nice bartender, friendly and welcoming vibe - a good find on a random Sunday.

The management and customer service is extremely terrible. The manager values cost over customer satisfaction. Because I value my money and time, I will no longer support this establishment. I’m good love, enjoy.
Great atmosphere, dope music, and decent happy hour. Their nachos are fire!
Great people and staff.  Drinks and food were delicious.   1831 Ownership shipped our DC mementos we left in the bar to our home at no cost.  Awesome customer service.  Thank you 1831

I really liked this bar. It’s in a great location. The bartenders were really nice and it didn’t take forever to get their attention. We got a bottle of wine and enjoyed the ambience. Also the music was spot on.

Came by for happy hour.  The specials for drinks were pretty good,  but the music was too loud and the service not the most professional (loud singing and dancing and playing). May come back to party but not for HH
Bartenders are awesome and fun and the vibe is high, went here after the strip club and saw better dancing lol.
Good beer, good snack, good place

We hosted a work happy hour here and to say I was impressed is an understatement! The staff was helpful and efficient, the space was perfect for our group of 35 and the food was DELICIOUS! They worked with our budget and helped make the night a success! Will definitely be coming back again!!
A legit dive adjacent neighborhood bar with a mystery drink. Definitely a cocktail focus,but a passable tap list. Tamyka was a great bartender, and the drinks were solid.
My fav bar when I come to dc bars better then Adams Morgan baby
Must go to if u r in area! Good food and good times...
ACTUALLY AUTHENTIC AND DELICIOUS HURRICANE COCKTAIL; I LOVE!!!
Not sure why folks rave about this place. Some of the staff could use some training.
Nice place to hangout with pals. Drinks and food for great price.
Rocking chill vibe, you know, ask them, the dog and pony.... really...
Nice Bar with good choice, a bit too pricey for what they offer
#1 bar in entire DC area; best happy hour on the East Coast; great service and atmosphere for game watches.
Best Bar in DC; incredible Happy Hour and Food; most enjoyable place for sports game watches; excellent service!
Wings and burgers are the best here, the atmosphere is good.
Great food; great service; great everything!!!
They serve their food on paper plates..the food is not good and the service is "meh"

This was my first and last time visiting this establishment.   Meet some friends for Happy hour, servers were slow,  they took forever to bring out our orders, terrible  customer service.   The manager was rude as hell.

This place. If my alumni club didn’t hold game watches here I would not set foot inside this bar. Games are on a set schedule yet every single time, they greet a packed house with 2 overwhelmed and slow bartenders, making people wait 20 min plus for their drinks and checks. And if you want food - oh man forget it. Don’t come hungry, it will be FOREVER before your food shows up. Quotes I heard while waiting for my bill - “I got a stronger drink because who knows how long it will take them to get me another one” “I have never been this sober sitting at a bar” - never mind the hordes of people who just gave up and left. I’ll keep coming as long as we do game watches there, but with a flask and a packed lunch.
Bartender Rachel makes the BEST drinks! They have really good music too!
Kind of eh... Nothing was too special about this bar. Kind of empty on a Saturday night. Had a weird smell when we first walked in. Just wasn't too impressed at all. Left in about a half hour.
GREAT drinks and good vibes
The venue was great! Security and staff was friendly and fun! The DJ (djbuscuit)was killing! Definitely coming back and bringing friends!
Best place to host events!! Amazing experience! Love 1831 Bar & Lounge!
Good music.  They play more than top 40.
By far the best bar in town; incredible wings!
Best Happy Hour and Best Bar in the D.C. area!
Place wasn't bad but chicken was fried to hard nice flavor though.  Drinks were good. Me and some friends went around 11pm. Rachel was nice.

Best bar I've visited in awhile. Great atmosphere, drinks, and the wings are amazing! The upstairs lounge upstairs looks like a great place to host events as you can have your own private separate space with lots of seating and 3 displays. Will definitely make this a new regular for me!
awesome food, drinks and music.

Had a couple good mixed drinks and a beer between me and my wife. The music was oppressively loud for holding a conversation unless you wanted to yell, which I did not. The ambiance was okay. It did have so character. We had a brand new waitress that actually did a fine job. We needed a piece of our bill corrected, which was done correctly and without a fuss. If you like good drinks, okay happy hour prices, a few comfortable sitting areas, but no way to talk without yelling, this is your spot! Full disclosure - only went there the one time during happy hour when the bar was about a quarter full.
Nice lil spot chill atmosphere
Food and drinks were good. Service left something to be desired. We sat in the downstairs area. Server got some orders wrong, and was not very attentive.
Service was excellent; decent, but limited menu. Will visit again.

Best Happy Hour in DC... They have $1 Natty Lights and $2 shots... Do I need say anymore.. It's called Happy Hour for a reason otherwise go to the W Hotel to drop alot of $$$$ on one glass of the Devil's Nectar !! 😈😈😈🍺🍺🍺🍺

They have nice food and the prices are very reasonable. Wings are five dollars after 8 pm and they have a very good happy hour. Lots of food options. The music is great, mostly hip hop. The workers are very nice and polite.
Great drinks, great food, great prices.
Great happy hour specials
The bartenders are very cool especially Rachel.  The crowd was fun. The place seems to draw young professionals.  Wings were excellent!
We were able to organize a great party for 100+ people there.  Very professional staff.
Really good wings

Low-lit bar with simple ambiance and average music. Nothing to love but nothing to complain either (except for the food -- the bagel bites looked like made by a lousy teenager, sorry 1831). Was not crowded when I was there and everybody had a pleasant time drinking beers, wines, cocktails.

I had an opportunity to organize a party for roughly 100 people in this bar. It was very professionally executed, the staff was very kind to avail themselves to all our needs. The prices are very affordable, and the food and drinks were delicious! Highly recommend it for anytime, but especially for Happy Hours on Fridays!
Best Happy Hour; comfortable atmosphere!
My favorite place for drinks.
Great Bar!
Horrible service. Both waitresses and the manager were rude
Great Drinks! Great Place!
1831 Bar & Lounge is definitely the best bar in Washington, DC.; I agree; the drinks and the wings are excellent!
Great bar, delicious wings!
Best Happy Hour and the Best Wings in DC! Amazing both are in the exact same spot!!!

Great place to grab a couple of drinks after a long day. Service was attentive and atmosphere was buzzing. Like any popular bar, it can get a bit crowded at peak times. Just order the right drinks, and you won’t have a problem getting loose.
1831 Bar & Lounge has a wonderful atmosphere and the best happy hour in Washington, D.C. Look no further, there is no better place.
Amazing bar and service !!!!
Best wings in town!

Let me first start by saying this was a beautiful establishment, but the customer service was absolutely terrible. Myself and 3 other colleagues went on Saturday April 14, during happy hour. We ordered some drinks, never tasted of touched them, but no longer wanted them. So we asked to speak to managermet since the server was unwilling to take them back. The manager was just as rude, and unwelcoming as the sever. So to avoid the commotion and their unwillingness to provide us with a solution, I just went ahead and paid for the drinks. The manager still continued to patronized myself and my friends. Sh snatched  the empty glasses from our table and made sly remarks. I’d informed her they’d been paid for since her nor her staff was willing to rectify the situation. She then proceeded to go for security to come to our table, to again patronize and intimidate us more. We left the establishment with such disgust, and shock to know that an establishment could hire employees like this. But what was reassuring was that the owners took my complaint seriously and reached back out to me. For that and, that reason only did I then feel like an appreciated customer.
Best Bar & Lounge in Washington, D.C.
Excellent service, prices and ambient. One of my favorite bars in the area. Be aware that they only serve appetizers-type of food.
Best Bar in the Washington, D.C. Area!  #1 Happy Hour + Delicious Wings!
Small local bar great menu
Mike the bouncer is pretty chill

We hosted a happy hour here for a group...the server/bartender was very attentive to our group and the food was okay too. Everyone who attended was happy when we left. I would plan another afterwork event there.
good music, mediocre food and service.
Great
One of my favorite bars in DC! Good vibes at night, great bartenders, and music.
Very Good Happy Hour Spot

So I wanted to find a spot within walking distance from the hotel I was at to see the Cavs game and have some wangsssss and drankssss. I searched Sports bars and saw this place. I bookmarked it based on reviews and pictures I saw which I approved.  We entered the establishment after 8:00PM on a Friday and I was expecting a wait but we were seated right away in the lounge area straight ahead up a small flight of stairs. (Yesssss #MichaelJordanFistPump). First observations on other tables while we were being seated was that the atmosphere was amazing, loud and upbeat music rocking the joint. That was a good or bad thing depending how you look at things but for me this was a great thing which was what I expected per reviews I read. Our waitress was cool and very friendly. Now as we are seated I noticed that the lounge area seating can hold parties of up to 6 people easy with wide seating. Also you have plenty of privacy per booth in the lounge area to talk amongst yourselves and not worry about disturbing other around you. Our waiter was very helpful and suggesting certain drinks off the menu.  Another observation was the diversity of the customers sitting down and everyone had smiles throughout the restaurant and living it up. The customer service here was solid and the ambiance was electrifying.  - Appetizer/Sides: 4 out of 5 Stars  "Old Bay Flavored Wings" I am a huge Old Bay Season fan so when I saw this on the menu I didnt even blink to order and try these wings. They were soooooooooooooooo good if you are a n old bay season this is a must order. It was a tad bit strong on the seasoning but that worked fine for me but may be a little bit much for others so just a heads up there. She asked what dressing I wanted for the wings and I said Ranch but they came with Blue Cheese crumbs at the bottom which was not cool because I hate blue cheese lol. .5 star deducted due to the fact they do not make you aware of that especially if you say you dont want the blue cheese dressing with the wings that should be a hint.  "Asian Flavored Wings" The wings were good but didn't blow you away. The sauce was simple and lacked real pop and flavor to stand out for me and I requested no blue cheese crumbs this time which the waitress made sure she would have them take care of that.Solid wing but nothing mind blowing.  Overall the wings were good and I would definitely order them again I was too stuffed to try other wings options.  - Drinks: 4.5 out of 5 Stars  "Captain Nemo" Vodka, Peach Schnapps, Blue Curaco, Creme De Cassis, Pineapple, Sour, Sprite. It doesn't come off as strong but catches up with you later  "Steam Engine" Vodka, Malibu, Sweet Fruit Liqueur, Juice Blend. Very Sexy drink I approve worth ordering  "Patron Shot" Patron got the stamp of approval but I didnt drink it lol  Overall this place slightly exceeded my expectations in regarding to vibe and atmosphere which was great. The music played was more hip hop that was currently hot in the streets. Great place for good drinks and fun club like atmosphere to an extent. Decent size bar area to get your drink on and I believe they have numerous happy hour options at various times to get saucy before you leave for the drinkers out there. The ambiance alone and overall experience was worth coming here.  Tips:  1. For major sports fans that get caught by the sports bar label they only show games that are on ESPN, TNT etc.. they do not have NBA League pass so we could not see the Cavs game. So for those looking to see all games played that will not be the case.  2. Pay attention to the happy hour times because they have a happy hour in the late evening as well into the night.  3. The Food menu is very limited so do not come if you are more of food person as opposed to drinking because you will be disappointed
I love the atmosphere and the long islands. Very cool and laid back vibe
Cool place. I liked the music and atmosphere.
It takes way too long to get a drink here even when the bar isn't crowded. College dive crowd. You can do better unless that's what you're looking for.
Great place for HH. Drinks and food were good especially for the price. Great music too!
Nice
It is a good spot to hang out with friends ad have a few drinks.  Good music.
Owner went out of his way to make things right after a billing issue.
Good drinks
#1 Ranked Happy Hour in DC and well-deserving of this title.
Great service
Bartender is great
Awesome time for bday! Service & food were  great

This establishment gave me mix feelings. Upon walking in, I was met with a nice ambiance and a mix crowd. The atmosphere was nice. Music playing, customers conversing, and beautiful lighting. I went around 5pm on a Saturday and it surprised me to say the least how many people were in the bar. Sat down up stairs next to a great energetic couple who were comfortable enough to pick up a banter with my group. After that, things kind of went downhill. The servers have to work the upstairs and downstairs, which led to a little gap in return service. In a party of six, the food came out separately despite everyone placing their orders at the same time. We had to retrieve The server multiple times for the orders being incorrect. The food itself was not great. Edible to provide substance (except the wings; see pictures) but not nearly as good as it could have been.
Atmosphere was great! Food and Customer Service was good. When there is a crowd at the bar, it can get a little hairy. But overall, it was great place to be!

I was able to celebrate my 30th Birthday a couple of weeks ago at this fine venue and I must say it was a memorable experience! The staff/ management were very courteous and cooperative and made sure that I had a wonderful experience! Pricing was very reasonable, and was definitely worth it!
Love the drinks and the dj
Wonderful atmosphere, great ownership, amazing service! Highly recommended!
Good beer, and. a very cool staff.
My friend drinks did not contain the proper level of alcohol. The bartender denied to exchange the drink for a stronger drink.
Great bar, GREAT staff, excellent bartender!

The service and food were ok until I found a hair in my food. The manager came by and acknowledged the hair and offered to rectify the situation but ended up doing absolutely nothing. I will not be going back. I can do without hair in my food.
Ok dive bar.  Drinks are expensive and not great.  Wait staff weren't familiar with their own menu.  And the place smells funky.  Like feet.
Amaz-balls!!!!
Great atmosphere for college football, the bar was very clean and the staff was polite and helpful. Definitely going to be one of my go-to bars from now on.
Sports watching and drinking with fun crowd in a small place
The bartenders here are friendly and fun. Domoniquie is great! Love her! Late night food menu could stand to be updated tho. But I thoroughly enjoyed myself.

Our first time in DC and we found this little gem. Awesome happy hour prices. Cutest, nicest bartender and such a fun atmosphere. Place is just super cool and trendy. Definitely take some time to come out here. This will certainly be on our list of places to visit again when we come back! Thanks for showing us such a great time at this bar.
Ordered drinks from the bartender and she immediately moved on and forgot my drinks. Music was also far too loud.

I've been to this bar twice. BOTH times I was here the bartender cussed out customers. I understand when customers are drunk and rude but that wasn't the case either time. The first time was when a customer asked if wings were included in the happy hour, she could have said a simple yes or no, but she literally just cussed him out and walked away. I was immediately uncomfortable and wanted to leave. It's crazy how an unprofessional bartender just ruins a place.
Did not love or hate the bar. We only had one drink and no food... Although it looked good. It is more of a hip hop bar. The dj on a Saturday was good when we went.

Sean, Dexter and LV were great and helped me celebrate my 30th birthday at very short notice. They gave me a discount for the booking and also surprised me with a free bottle of champagne! Very kind of them And my friends had a great time:) highly recommended. Music was fantastic too :)
Great drinks and good music

This is the only bar where the bartender dance along with the music while preparing their drinks! Music was amazing and I enjoyed the night so much so that I couldn't take a proper photo as I was busy dancing!

I hosted a small gathering at 1831 on 7/28. The space is in pristine condition! Very clean, smells divine, bathrooms are bright and well stocked, the staff is friendly, and the atmosphere is casual and cool. The steampunk decor is cool, with dim lighting/chandeliers. The food is great (how can tater tots taste so good, and the wings are delicious too), and the drinks are strong. The bartenders make you feel at home, and Sean was a dream to work with regarding getting my reservation set-up. Everyone was SUPER attentive, and I will definitely be back. My only con for the night was the new DJ that made his debut there. We had to text him songs we wanted to hear. Hopefully, I won't have to work so hard next time, as 1831 is known to have great music! See you guys soon!
Great atmosphere, popping bar & SHOOTERS, also a dance floor WITH A BANGING MENU!! Bagel bites, smores, & mozz sticks are so DELICIOUS!

I have visited 1831 many times since they opened last year and the team always goes above and beyond to serve us. The happy hour specials are some of the best in the city ($15 bottles of wine) and their late night menu is fantastic (bagel bites and mozzarella sticks for $5)! My friends and I will surely be back soon!
Great staff, great signature drinks. Captain Nemo is yummy and dangerous too 😌

After the brewcrafter conference we were just looking to kick back and have some wings. Well we walked in and Lavenia made us feel immediately welcome. Her energy and excitement and close attention to our group  made us feel so welcome. Their special updates on drinks, food and snacks just kept coming and made us stay longer and feel a part of the regular gang Shout out to Lavenia, our awesome hostess and waitress!
Ambience is not too good, more of a college bar. I have seen way better happy hours

Hosted our wedding welcome party here on the second level. The owners were great to work with and have some of the best prices in the area. They set up a great spread for us and were available for us and any of our needs the whole evening. The waitstaff was also attentive and pleasant. I would definitely recommend them for any private events.
Hands down the nicest bartender in DC! Will definitely visit next time I'm in town
A couple weeks ago I decided to celebrate my birthday at 1831 Bar & Lounge with a group of friends. Everyone was super nice and accommodating and we had a great time. Will definitely be back!
Love it

The D.C. chapter of the UMiami Alumni Association often hosts Happy Hours here, and we love this place.  Happy Hour drink specials are unbeatable, and the upstairs room is great for game-watches or any kind of semi-private event.  We even did a Nerd-Nite style event recently b/c they have several tvs and a projector screen.  Great bar owners!

They offer a quick tour showing the process of distilling spirits unique to the Nevada desert. You can actually buy a barrel and make your own while they house the barrel! There is a walking tour as well that you can sign up for to where you can visit this distillery, a couple of breweries and a winery. A great time to hang out in the "Booze District" in Henderson Nevada, learn about how it's done, and sample.some of the best the desert has to offer.
Late 90s to early 2000s hip hop DJ on Friday night, happy hour until 8pm.
Nice bar, friendly staff and great atmosphere.
Two stories. Friendly staff. Good drinks.
Dive bar with class. Super cheap drinks from open to close.

This place used to be the Mighty Pint; however, it's been upgraded nicely. Must brighter, which gives it the appearance of being bigger, staff was very friendly, service was good, Happy Hour specials were great for the area. Didn't order any food. Sean, one of the owners, was very accommodating to the group happy hour I was planning. Would definitely go back to them for future events and general happy hour merriment.
The lounge area is on point. Get there early though as it really filled up later in the evening.
Brought a date here on Thursday night, they had great drinks, nice atmosphere, good music with a DJ, and the salt n vinegar wings were amazing! We both had a blast and will def be back!

Simply put - If you are thinking of hosting an event in the city, you need to call 1831 Bar & Lounge...end of story....I hosted my 37th birthday party here and the experience from planning to execution was nothing short of amazing!  I let them know that my crowd was a cool hip hop/neo soul crowd that would be looking for a great party with a DJ and they worked with me to get every detail right about what I was looking for, and offered me a plethora of options to ensure me and my guest would have an awesome time.  The food is amazing and every single person on staff from security to the bartenders and waiters who work in the restaurant were polite, professional and committed to making sure you had a GREAT experience.  I wish that I could give this place more than 5 stars because they are well worth it!
Been twice they nice decoration and good music selection.  Kinda small.
Amazing atmosphere + amazing bartender (Yes, I mean you Karen) = best bar in DC
Great atmosphere. Friendly staff. Very cool place!

Hosted a surprise happy hour party for my husbands 35th. Everyone from the owners to the managers and bartenders  were very accommodating and so nice. Competitive pricing on their space rental, and food. The food in particular the wings. The Dj was great all night and he played a mixture of hip hop, house, and some old school goodies  I was very impressed with the level of customer service and it didn't hurt that the drinks were strong and delicious. We will definitely be back in the future. Thank you so much for helping me surprise my husband and enjoy his birthday with our friends and family. I was happy to plan my first event here instead of being ripped off for $3000 bottle service lol. Thanks again bar 1831  Brittany

Been before for happy hour and the specials are awesome. Decided to have our Sales Team holiday party there and we weren't disappointed! Food was great, staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, and the 'upstairs' space in the back was perfect for our group. Would highly recommend as a location for HH and special events. Thanks Jeff!!!

I hosted a company party at 1831 and it was absolutely perfect.  The staff was extremely accommodating and responsive.  The food was fantastic and my team enjoyed the evening.  We will definitely be making 1831 a staple for happy hours and team outings.
Whiskey ginger and popcorn

1831 is a great place! The atmosphere is unique, food is really tasty and I love their late nite $5 food menu that has mozzarella sticks and pizza bagel bites! They have Heavy Seas loose cannon on tap, delirium and tons of other beer liquor options to choose from. Frequently have DJs and a real good diverse crowd. Highly recommended and will be a frequent here!
It's a very small place.

Not certain what others see here. The barkeeps have no knowledge of cocktail classics like a negroni or Sazerac, beer selection is very limited, and I didn't try the food.  Service was friendly, however, and the place was reasonably clean.
Friendly environment, friendly staff, and the place is very clean, which is so much better than the other bars in the area.
Bartenders and prices are really great. Music is loud and limited to pretty graphic hip hop.
Great place to dance

Hosted a Happy Hour Reception here, the service from beginning to the end was impeccable. The staff is very responsive and personable and the waitress are as well. The food was awesome and the atmosphere was great. They offer great Happy Hour specials! I will definitely do another event here!

One of the cheapest happy hours in DC.  Pleasant atmosphere where you can actually hear the people around you (it's still pretty loud).  More non-fried things on the food menu would be good, but, for what it is, the place is pretty good.
Dj big Mike is dope

I have been there a few times. However, I hosted my bday party there. They have a room in the back with separate music. They allowed me to choose playlist, change TV channels. Service was great and attentive. Recommended.
The best little chill spot me and my friend ever ran across.  OPEN LATE and the shooters are too delicious
Great, fun atmosphere! The bar is well stocked, and there is plenty of room to dance at night. You can also get a complimentary bottle of champagne on your birthday!
we come here a lot before kickball games. their happy hour is great and the bartenders are always friendly!
Dollar keystone during happy hours 🍺🍻🍸
Great atmosphere, great and helpful staff! Would definitely recommend to stop by for a few drinks!

We got there at 7pm for an early drink, the music was really loud although there was only 3 people in the bar. I ordered the 1831, which was really not good at all. I tried to drink it but couldn't, so ordered a simple rum drink, thinking they couldn't mess it up, but they did. Very bad experience there. I do not recommend this place unless you want a clubbing experience.

I hosted my music video release there and everyone was very professional with great sound and video connection and a nice area sectioned off. Great music, food, and drink selection. The people i invited still talk about!
If you are looking for a fun bar that has the best music on M street, look no further.  The ambiance is great with nice lights and a huge bar.

We hosted a University of Miami reception at 1831 and were excited to support this bar owned by Canes! We had a fantastic experience - the staff was very helpful and accommodating, food was great and very reasonably priced for the amount of food, great drink specials, and a cool vibe that was perfect for our students and young alumni. We will definitely be back!

This place is very confortable and friendly. It is always very clean and the workers are always ready to help. The beers and the food have good quality and there is a very diversified menu as well. The owners are also very nice. 5 stars, no doubt!
Just celebrated my birthday there without 100 of my friends. EVERYONE had a great time and the service and the people were great.

Let us first say, thank you 1831 Bar & Lounge for such good service and engaging atmosphere!  We are a collective of artists located in the DC, Maryland, and Virginia metropolitan area. This past weekend we hosted a release party for our very first musical EP “No Seats.” 1831 Bar & Lounge was happy to provide us access to their venue for our event. We set up a stage, microphones, speakers and of course a DJ. We were able to connect our equipment to their sound system which provided quality sound throughout the whole venue. Also, to help create the intimate ambiance that we desired for our guests; televisions and projector screens were made available to us so that we could display our visuals and graphics throughout the entire night.  This event was very busy! We had over 130 guests at his event and the bar & kitchen staff maintained a sense of urgency and provided exemplary service for the entire time we were there. The food was delicious and the drinks were awesome! People ordered wings, nachos, and burgers all night!  1831 Bar & Lounge is a sexy place. There is a detailed mural on the wall, blue lighting on the ceiling as well as under the bar and on different areas on the wall. There was a decent balance of seating as well as open space for everyone to dance and enjoy themselves.  The owners were very polite, hospitable, and catering to us and all of our guests that attended our party. Bartenders were friendly and outgoing. Sean, the manager, made sure that we didn’t have anything to worry about. He made us feel right at home.  This past weekend was phenomenal. We would definitely recommend 1831 to anyone looking for a good time!  -The Aim Society

I just wanted to say a huge thank you for so generously hosting our event this evening. Your staff really could not have been more helpful, and it worked exactly as we had hoped. It was great to have the space up the stairs at the back, and all the technology worked perfectly - I heard how long it took to be able to wire it so that the different screens showed different things, so thank you!  I am very pleased to say that we raised just over $1000 for our charities, and so each will be getting over $500 which should be able to have a really positive impact, given that their operating costs are so low.  So thank you again for collaborating with us on this, and for making it run so smoothly.  Will, Georgetown Refugee Action
Nice atmosphere but worst drinks ever. Margarita = lime water  (no liquor)
Great atmosphere and staff. The bar is very inviting and cozy and the food is good. Will definitely be back. The live music at the No Seats Release party was a plus!

I am the board member of a local production organization and we hosted a happy hour networking event at 1831 and it went fantastic. Members loved the happy hour prices and it is so centrally located in DC that it really benefited our membership who came from different parts of the city. The bar owner Jean-Paul was very accommodating and we are looking forward to our next event
Amazing service and crowd
Great atmosphere and amazing service. I highly recommend 1831 as a place to enjoy good food and a fine adult beverage.
Amazing bar, amazing food, amazing service. Will be back!
Awesome bar with friendly staff and great specials ($1 beers on Sunday night).
Great Wings!! Pretty waitresses 😊
A charming place with a huge selection of beers and drinks. The staff is so friendly which makes you don't feel like leaving the place. Would definitely come back!!!
The drinks are awesome and so is the atmosphere! Feels like a hidden gem in the DuPont area!

I have been to 1831 a few times now and had a great experience each time. The staff is friendly, the food is delish, and the cool atmosphere combines lowkey with steampunk. The upstairs part is especially good for watching football with friends because of the big booths and huge tv's. I look forward to going back!
Great food. Try the flatbread for sure. Great bartenders good prices fun crowd and atmosphere. I've been a few times and its consistently a fun place!

Best lounge in DC!! I don't go to DC much since I live in NYC, but last month I went to visit a friend for 2 days and a night and this lounge was the only place we went to  for drinks and we had a blast! The music was great, the drinks were well made, attractive staff and amazing customer service. The owners were present at the time and personally came to attend us with a drink on the house! So I gave it 5 stars!

Great place for drinks after work/happy hour/watching sports/any casual night. The beer + cocktail selection and even the bar food will not disappoint. The atmosphere stays friendly & so does the music! Highly recommend if you're ever in the Dupont area!
Stumbled upon this place during the PubCrawl on Halloween. Great staff, fair prices, fun atmosphere! My new go-to spot Downtown!

Moving from New York I didn't think DC had much to offer in terms of a fun night scene but after experiencing 1831, I take it back. For a bar, I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and innovation in their food. I believe that a bar is only as good as their buffalo wings and 1831 does not disappoint. I've even heard people who don't drink go in for their wings alone. I have officially experienced bar food like never before. I want the recipe for the spice they add to their complimentary popcorn and now if my caesar salad does not have grilled romaine lettuce, well then you can just take it back. The ambiance is cool, spacious and comfortable for anyone. They have two levels perfect for small to large sized groups. I have already looked into renting out the top level for my Birthday and they offered to throw in a DJ. The staff is super friendly and accommodating. I am an 1831 believer!!
